intro: Senecio tarapotensis, commonly known as the Andean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, hairy, and arranged in a rosette pattern, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Senecio tarapotensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands at elevations above 3,000 meters.
